content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://data.nodc.noaa.gov/coris/data/CoRIS/fgdc_schema_coris/fgdc-std-001-1998.xsd">  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>NOAA Coral Reef Watch program</origin>     <pubdate>20140731</pubdate>     <title>NOAA Coral Reef Watch Thermal History Metrics</title>     <edition>One</edition>     <geoform>image, webpage</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>College Park, Maryland, USA</pubplace>      <publish>NOAA Coral Reef Watch program</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>http://coralreefwatch.noaa.gov/satellite/thermal_history/th_index.php</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>Climate change threatens even the best-protected and most-remote tropical coral reef ecosystems worldwide. Reef management in the face of climate change must incorporate how various factors (e.g., benthic structure, currents, local upwelling, connectivity, herbivore abundance, and thermal history) affect coral and reef ecosystem resilience. Research over the last decade indicates that thermal history is among the most important factors influencing coral reef resilience.  With support from the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Coral Reef Conservation Program, Coral Reef Watch (whose mission is to utilize remote sensing, modeled, and in situ tools for near-real-time and long term monitoring, modeling and reporting of physical environmental conditions of coral reef ecosystems) has developed a variety of Thermal History metrics for coral reef management. Several metrics are calculated for reef-containing locations and adjacent waters and are arranged into three themes: Historical Variability, Stress Frequency, and Onset Timing.  These metrics were derived from the Pathfinder version 5.2 ~4km (1/24) daily Sea Surface Temperature (SST) data set for the period 1985-2012, provided by the Group for High Resolution Sea Surface Temperature (GHRSST) and the NOAA National Oceanographic Data Center. The Pathfinder project was supported in part by a grant from the NOAA Climate Data Record (CDR) Program for satellites.</abstract>    <purpose>By providing information on the thermal history of reef locations and adjacent waters globally, these metrics complement the suite of monitoring and prediction products that CRW has developed as a decision support system (DSS) to provide critical and timely coral reef environment information to the U.S. and international coral reef communities.</purpose>    <supplinf>The entire suite of products mentioned herein is accessible at: http://coralreefwatch.noaa.gov/satellite/</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <rngdates>      <begdate>19850101</begdate>      <enddate>20121231</enddate>     </rngdates> More detailed information can be found on the product description webpage for the metrics (http://coralreefwatch.noaa.gov/satellite/thermalhistory/th_index.php).</attraccr>   </attracc>   <logic>none</logic>   <complete>This is the first release of these products, which will be evaluated by scientists, managers and other reef stakeholders around the world. Values are provided for pixels containing reefs, and those within a buffer distance of reef locations, as identified in the ReefBase, Millennium Mapping Project and Reefs at Risk datasets. Product revision will be based on user feedback.</complete>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <horizpar>Users are referred to the NOAA/NODC AVHRR Pathfinder Version 5.2 SST website at and 1667 grid intersections in each column (at a pre-defined longitude). Each grid is 0.0416667 degrees latitude by 0.0416667 degrees longitude in size, centered at latitudes from 35.2708S northward to 34.1458N and at longitudes from 179.9792W eastward to 179.9792E.</enttypd>     <enttypds>http://coralreefwatch.noaa.gov/satellite/thermalhistory/th_index.php</enttypds>    </enttyp>    <attr>     <attrlabl>NOAA Coral Reef Watch Thermal History Metrics images in PNG format</attrlabl>     <attrdef>These are the image display of the Thermal History data</attrdef>     <attrdefs>http://coralreefwatch.noaa.gov/satellite/thermalhistory/th_index.php</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <rdom>       <rdommin>0</rdommin>       <rdommax>255</rdommax>       <attrunit>Index color values</attrunit>      </rdom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>   </detailed>  </eainfo>  <distinfo>   <distrib>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>NOAA Coral Reef Watch program</cntorg>      <cntper>NOAA Coral Reef Watch Coordinator</cntper>     </cntorgp>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>      <address>NOAA/NESDIS/STAR Coral Reef Watch, NCWCP, E/RA3, Room 3222, 5830 University Research Court</address>      <city>College Park</city>      <state>Maryland</state>      <postal>20740</postal>      <country>USA</country>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>301-683-3320</cntvoice>     <cntfax>301-683-3301</cntfax>     <cntemail>coralreefwatch@noaa.gov</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </distrib>   <resdesc>Downloadable Data</resdesc>   <distliab>NOAA makes no warranty regarding these data, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
